displayed_text: Doctor: Okay? So, we’ll give it a couple of weeks for you to heal up, get over this. Then, we will get back on the chemotherapy. Okay? Doctor: Mmm,hmm Patient: By my name. Don’t accept it and call the police.” Doctor: Okay Patient: I say, “What you do? Call the police.” I say, “I’m gonna make a police report. Call the police.” ‘Cuz whoever, if somebody tried to come in and, and fill up scripts. Doctor: Okay Patient: ‘Cuz see, I don’t know how I got careless, and, and, but I keep a lot of stuff in my pockets. When it happened before where I was. Doctor: Okay. Patient: So, I did like I said, did like I told her and she been like I told you (Miss F_ and I said) Doctor: Mm, hmm. Patient: And call me. Let my daughter know and let me know.” ‘Cuz I’m sure I’m gonna press charges. I swear to God, I’m gonna press charges. Doctor: Yeah. Okay. So, what happened then? Did they give you the medication? Patient: Huh?

Patient: Yeah, okay. Doctor: You know once we’re… Patient: Yeah. Doctor: The good news is when I see this though it tells me it will die. Patient: Sure. Doctor: Because sometimes we give the chemo and it just keeps on going and you’re like what happened? Didn’t I just poison you? Patient: Thank you, Yeah thank you. Doctor: So it’s finally actually going in the right direction. Patient: Okay. Doctor: But you will need to continue on the prednisone also which I forgot to ask you are you still on that? Patient: I’m still taking it yeah. Doctor: Perfect so you know the job isn’t done, but once we get more chemo on board you should feel better. But also just pain medicine wise, so what are you taking? Anything right now?

Family Member: Gotcha. Doctor: That’s the problem. Patient: I’m not eating less. Doctor: Yeah. Patient: I do feel that I’m eating better… Um… Family Member: Mhmm. Doctor: Yeah because you got a week off. Patient: Pardon? Family Member: Oh no. (laughs) Patient: Oh no, no. My, my uh… My appetite has never been affected by this medication. Doctor: Okay. Alright. Patient: I do notice one thing while I was off. I I can feel the difference in the energy level. Doctor: Yeah. Which is probably not helping me having you drink more because then you’re just more active and on the go.

Patient: I was just checking. Doctor: What was the number? Patient: I don’t know. Doctor: Let’s see the damage. Bom Bom Bom. Patient: I was checking. Doctor: How sugar’s been you think? Patient: I was just checking. Doctor: Well, I think I’m dandy. The question is are you dandy? Family Member: Right. We haven’t got the blood work back yet, so. Doctor: Yeah. PSA’s not back. The rest of you is actually okay. Family Member: He was going through, he went through a rough time after radiation. You probably talked to the other doctor. I mean he was on his hands and knees with his head on the couch. And I went, J___, you need to go up and get in bed. Doctor: Yeah. Family Member: He was pretty bad.
